newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-off $0.50-private.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen flat-off $0.50-private.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Wednesday were seen steady to $0.50 per cwt lower amid outlooks for increased hog marketings as farmers move hogs before the Independence Day holiday on Friday, livestock dealers and packer buyers said.

Relatively large marketings on Tuesday also were seen weighing on cash prices, with several packer buyers in the southern Minnesota/interior Iowa area indicating they were close to having Wednesday slaughter needs filled.
"We ended up with a good run today. I can see us backing away from the market early on Wednesday," one buyer said.
Forecasts for cooler, less humid weather on Wednesday also could result in more hogs coming to market, dealers said.
Price declines could be tempered, however, if marketings Wednesday come in lighter than anticipated which could force packers to vie for available supplies, some sources said.
Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota top prices for hogs delivered to the plant on Wednesday were seen at $62.00-$62.50 and Illinois top prices could range $60.50-$61.00, sources in those areas said.
Indiana/Ohio top prices at plants were seen at $60.50 to $61.50.
